content:
Please execute the following task in my repository mcpmark-eval-zl/EasyR1:

The EasyR1 repository has several Qwen3-related issues that were closed but need to be reopened for further investigation. Qwen3 is an important model variant that requires continued attention. I need you to find and reopen all closed issues related to Qwen3 and properly tag them for tracking.

**Step 1: Find All Closed Qwen3 Issues**
Search for ALL closed issues that mention 'qwen3' (case-insensitive) in either the title or body. Make note of each issue number and title.

**Step 2: Reopen Each Qwen3 Issue**
For every closed issue that contains 'qwen3' (regardless of when it was closed or any other factors), reopen it by changing its state from closed to open.

**Step 3: Add Tracking Label**
After reopening each issue, add the label `qwen3-related` to it. This will help track all Qwen3-related issues in the future.

**Step 4: Create Summary Issue**
Create a new issue titled "Reopened Qwen3 Issues Summary" with the following content in the body:
```
# Qwen3 Issues Reopened

The following closed issues containing 'qwen3' have been reopened:

[List each reopened issue as: - #NUMBER: TITLE]

Total issues reopened: [NUMBER]

All reopened issues have been tagged with the `qwen3-related` label for easy tracking.
```

Add the label `qwen3-related` to this summary issue as well.

This straightforward workflow ensures all Qwen3-related closed issues are reopened and properly tagged for visibility.

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

content.text: I'll help you execute this task to find and reopen all closed Qwen3-related issues in your repository. Let me start by discovering the available GitHub actions.

arguments: {"server_names": ["GitHub"], "user_query": "find closed issues, reopen issues, add labels, create issues"}
name: discover_server_categories_or_actions

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"servers\\\":{\\\"GitHub\\\":{\\\"detail_level\\\":\\\"categories_only\\\",\\\"details\\\":[\\\"GITHUB_META\\\",\\\"GITHUB_SECURITY-ADVISORIES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_APPS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CLASSROOM\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CODES-OF-CONDUCT\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CREDENTIALS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_EMOJIS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CODE-SECURITY\\\",\\\"GITHUB_DEPENDABOT\\\",\\\"GITHUB_SECRET-SCANNING\\\",\\\"GITHUB_ACTIVITY\\\",\\\"GITHUB_GISTS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_GITIGNORE\\\",\\\"GITHUB_ISSUES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_LICENSES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_MARKDOWN\\\",\\\"GITHUB_ORGS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_BILLING\\\",\\\"GITHUB_ACTIONS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_OIDC\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CAMPAIGNS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CODE-SCANNING\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CODESPACES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_COPILOT\\\",\\\"GITHUB_PACKAGES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_INTERACTIONS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_MIGRATIONS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_PRIVATE-REGISTRIES\\\",\\\"GITHUB_PROJECTS-CLASSIC\\\",\\\"GITHUB_REPOS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_HOSTED-COMPUTE\\\",\\\"GITHUB_TEAMS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_REACTIONS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_RATE-LIMIT\\\",\\\"GITHUB_CHECKS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_DEPENDENCY-GRAPH\\\",\\\"GITHUB_GIT\\\",\\\"GITHUB_PULLS\\\",\\\"GITHUB_SEARCH\\\",\\\"GITHUB_USERS\\\"]}}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me get the details for the GitHub issues category to understand available actions:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"category_actions\\\":{\\\"GITHUB_ISSUES\\\":[\\\"list\\\",\\\"list_for_org\\\",\\\"list_assignees\\\",\\\"check_user_can_be_assigned\\\",\\\"list_for_repo\\\",\\\"create\\\",\\\"list_comments_for_repo\\\",\\\"get_comment\\\",\\\"update_comment\\\",\\\"delete_comment\\\",\\\"list_events_for_repo\\\",\\\"get_event\\\",\\\"get\\\",\\\"update\\\",\\\"add_assignees\\\",\\\"remove_assignees\\\",\\\"check_user_can_be_assigned_to_issue\\\",\\\"list_comments\\\",\\\"create_comment\\\",\\\"list_dependencies_blocked_by\\\",\\\"add_blocked_by_dependency\\\",\\\"remove_dependency_blocked_by\\\",\\\"list_dependencies_blocking\\\",\\\"list_events\\\",\\\"list_labels_on_issue\\\",\\\"add_labels\\\",\\\"set_labels\\\",\\\"remove_all_labels\\\",\\\"remove_label\\\",\\\"lock\\\",\\\"unlock\\\",\\\"get_parent\\\",\\\"remove_sub_issue\\\",\\\"list_sub_issues\\\",\\\"add_sub_issue\\\",\\\"reprioritize_sub_issue\\\",\\\"list_events_for_timeline\\\",\\\"list_labels_for_repo\\\",\\\"create_label\\\",\\\"get_label\\\",\\\"update_label\\\",\\\"delete_label\\\",\\\"list_milestones\\\",\\\"create_milestone\\\",\\\"get_milestone\\\",\\\"update_milestone\\\",\\\"delete_milestone\\\",\\\"list_labels_for_milestone\\\",\\\"list_for_authenticated_user\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: I also need to check the search category to find closed issues:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"category_actions\\\":{\\\"GITHUB_SEARCH\\\":[\\\"code\\\",\\\"commits\\\",\\\"issues_and_pull_requests\\\",\\\"labels\\\",\\\"repos\\\",\\\"topics\\\",\\\"users\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Great! Now let me get the details for the search action to find issues and the issue update action:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"issues_and_pull_requests\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"GET\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/search/issues\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"> [!WARNING]\\\\n> **Notice:** Search for issues and pull requests will be overridden by advanced search on September 4, 2025.\\\\n> You can read more about this change on [the GitHub blog](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-03-06-github-issues-projects-api-support-for-issues-advanced-search-and-more/).\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[\\\"search\\\"],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{\\\"q\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The query contains one or more search keywords and qualifiers. Qualifiers allow you to limit your search to specific areas of GitHub. The REST API supports the same qualifiers as the web interface for GitHub. To learn more about the format of the query, see [Constructing a search query](https://docs.github.com/rest/search/search#constructing-a-search-query). See \\\\\\\"[Searching issues and pull requests](https://docs.github.com/search-github/searching-on-github/searching-issues-and-pull-requests)\\\\\\\" for a detailed list of qualifiers.\\\"},\\\"sort\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Sorts the results of your query by the number of `comments`, `reactions`, `reactions-+1`, `reactions--1`, `reactions-smile`, `reactions-thinking_face`, `reactions-heart`, `reactions-tada`, or `interactions`. You can also sort results by how recently the items were `created` or `updated`, Default: [best match](https://docs.github.com/rest/search/search#ranking-search-results)\\\"},\\\"order\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Determines whether the first search result returned is the highest number of matches (`desc`) or lowest number of matches (`asc`). This parameter is ignored unless you provide `sort`.\\\"},\\\"per_page\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of results per page (max 100). For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api).\\\\\\\"\\\"},\\\"page\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The page number of the results to fetch. For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Using pagination in the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/using-pagination-in-the-rest-api).\\\\\\\"\\\"},\\\"advanced_search\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Set to `true` to use advanced search.\\\\nExample: `http://api.github.com/search/issues?q={query}&advanced_search=true`\\\"}},\\\"body_schema\\\":{},\\\"response_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"total_count\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"incomplete_results\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"total_count\\\",\\\"incomplete_results\\\",\\\"items\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

{"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"update\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"PATCH\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{issue_number}\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Issue owners and users with push access or Triage role can edit an issue.\\\\n\\\\nThis endpoint supports the following custom media types. For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Media types](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/getting-started-with-the-rest-api#media-types).\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.raw+json`**: Returns the raw markdown body. Response will include `body`. This is the default if you do not pass any specific media type.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.text+json`**: Returns a text only representation of the markdown body. Response will include `body_text`.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.html+json`**: Returns HTML rendered from the body's markdown. Response will include `body_html`.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.full+json`**: Returns raw, text, and HTML representations. Response will include `body`, `body_text`, and `body_html`.\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[\\\"issues\\\"],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"owner\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"},\\\"repo\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"},\\\"issue_number\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number that identifies the issue.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"null\\\",\\\"string\\\",\\\"integer\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"The title of the issue.\\\",\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\"}]},\\\"body\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"The contents of the issue.\\\"},\\\"assignee\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"Username to assign to this issue. **This field is closing down.**\\\"},\\\"state\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The open or closed state of the issue.\\\"},\\\"state_reason\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"The reason for the state change. Ignored unless `state` is changed.\\\"},\\\"milestone\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"null\\\",\\\"string\\\",\\\"integer\\\"],\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The `number` of the milestone to associate this issue with or use `null` to remove the current milestone. Only users with push access can set the milestone for issues. Without push access to the repository, milestone changes are silently dropped.\\\"}]},\\\"labels\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Labels to associate with this issue. Pass one or more labels to _replace_ the set of labels on this issue. Send an empty array (`[]`) to clear all labels from the issue. Only users with push access can set labels for issues. Without push access to the repository, label changes are silently dropped.\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"name\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"description\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"color\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true}}}]}},\\\"assignees\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Usernames to assign to this issue. Pass one or more user logins to _replace_ the set of assignees on this issue. Send an empty array (`[]`) to clear all assignees from the issue. Only users with push access can set assignees for new issues. Without push access to the repository, assignee changes are silently dropped.\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the issue type to associate with this issue or use `null` to remove the current issue type. Only users with push access can set the type for issues. Without push access to the repository, type changes are silently dropped.\\\"}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Issues are a great way to keep track of tasks, enhancements, and bugs for your projects.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"node_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"URL for the issue\\\"},\\\"repository_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"labels_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"comments_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"events_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"html_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"number\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Number uniquely identifying the issue within its repository\\\"},\\\"state\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"State of the issue; either 'open' or 'closed'\\\"},\\\"state_reason\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The reason for the current state\\\"},\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Title of the issue\\\"},\\\"body\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Contents of the issue\\\"},\\\"user\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"labels\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Labels to associate with this issue; pass one or more label names to replace the set of labels on this issue; send an empty array to clear all labels from the issue; note that the labels are silently dropped for users without push access to the repository\\\"},\\\"assignee\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"assignees\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"array\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"milestone\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"locked\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"active_lock_reason\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"comments\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"pull_request\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"closed_at\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"created_at\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"updated_at\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"draft\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"closed_by\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"body_html\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"body_text\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"timeline_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"object\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The the author is associated with the repository.\\\"},\\\"reactions\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"sub_issues_summary\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"parent_issue_url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"URL to get the parent issue of this issue, if it is a sub-issue\\\"},\\\"issue_dependencies_summary\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"issue_field_values\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"assignee\\\",\\\"closed_at\\\",\\\"comments\\\",\\\"comments_url\\\",\\\"events_url\\\",\\\"html_url\\\",\\\"id\\\",\\\"node_id\\\",\\\"labels\\\",\\\"labels_url\\\",\\\"milestone\\\",\\\"number\\\",\\\"repository_url\\\",\\\"state\\\",\\\"locked\\\",\\\"title\\\",\\\"url\\\",\\\"user\\\",\\\"author_association\\\",\\\"created_at\\\",\\\"updated_at\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

{"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"add_labels\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues/{issue_number}/labels\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Adds labels to an issue. If you provide an empty array of labels, all labels are removed from the issue. \\\",\\\"tags\\\":[\\\"issues\\\"],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"owner\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"},\\\"repo\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"},\\\"issue_number\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number that identifies the issue.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"labels\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The names of the labels to add to the issue's existing labels. You can pass an empty array to remove all labels. Alternatively, you can pass a single label as a `string` or an `array` of labels directly, but GitHub recommends passing an object with the `labels` key. You can also replace all of the labels for an issue. For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Set labels for an issue](https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/labels#set-labels-for-an-issue).\\\\\\\"\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}}}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"labels\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"name\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"name\\\"]}}}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"name\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"name\\\"]}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}]},\\\"response_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Color-coded labels help you categorize and filter your issues (just like labels in Gmail).\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Unique identifier for the label.\\\"},\\\"node_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"url\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"URL for the label\\\"},\\\"name\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the label.\\\"},\\\"description\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Optional description of the label, such as its purpose.\\\"},\\\"color\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"6-character hex code, without the leading #, identifying the color\\\"},\\\"default\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Whether this label comes by default in a new repository.\\\"}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"id\\\",\\\"node_id\\\",\\\"url\\\",\\\"name\\\",\\\"description\\\",\\\"color\\\",\\\"default\\\"]}}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

{"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"create\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/repos/{owner}/{repo}/issues\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Any user with pull access to a repository can create an issue. If [issues are disabled in the repository](https://docs.github.com/articles/disabling-issues/), the API returns a `410 Gone` status.\\\\n\\\\nThis endpoint triggers [notifications](https://docs.github.com/github/managing-subscriptions-and-notifications-on-github/about-notifications). Creating content too quickly using this endpoint may result in secondary rate limiting. For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Rate limits for the API](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/rate-limits-for-the-rest-api#about-secondary-rate-limits)\\\\\\\"\\\\nand \\\\\\\"[Best practices for using the REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/guides/best-practices-for-using-the-rest-api).\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\nThis endpoint supports the following custom media types. For more information, see \\\\\\\"[Media types](https://docs.github.com/rest/using-the-rest-api/getting-started-with-the-rest-api#media-types).\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.raw+json`**: Returns the raw markdown body. Response will include `body`. This is the default if you do not pass any specific media type.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.text+json`**: Returns a text only representation of the markdown body. Response will include `body_text`.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.html+json`**: Returns HTML rendered from the body's markdown. Response will include `body_html`.\\\\n- **`application/vnd.github.full+json`**: Returns raw, text, and HTML representations. Response will include `body`, `body_text`, and `body_html`.\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[\\\"issues\\\"],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"owner\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"},\\\"repo\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the repository without the `.git` extension. The name is not case sensitive.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"description\\\":\\\"The title of the issue.\\\",\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\"}]},\\\"body\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The contents of the issue.\\\"},\\\"assignee\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"string\\\",\\\"null\\\"],\\\"description\\\":\\\"Login for the user that this issue should be assigned to. _NOTE: Only users with push access can set the assignee for new issues. The assignee is silently dropped otherwise. **This field is closing down.**_\\\"},\\\"milestone\\\":{\\\"type\\\":[\\\"null\\\",\\\"string\\\",\\\"integer\\\"],\\\"oneOf\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The `number` of the milestone to associate this issue with. _NOTE: Only users with push access can set the milestone for new issues. The milestone is silently dropped otherwise._\\\"}]},\\\"labels\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Labels to associate with this issue. _NOTE: Only users with push access can set labels for new issues. Now I can see that:
- Issue #49 contains "Qwen3-8B" in both title and body - this is a clear match
